snippet: A compromise plan now seems to have enough votes to overcome a filibuster threat in the Senate and move on to passage by a simple majority.
abstract: Support for compromise two-year budget deal grows ahead of vote in Senate as Republicans conclude they could not allow measure that passed House with overwhelming bipartisan support die in Congress's upper chamber; compromise plan now seems to have enough votes to overcome filibuster threat and move on to passage by simple majority.
lead_paragraph: A compromise plan now seems to have enough votes to overcome a filibuster threat in the Senate and move on to passage by a simple majority.

headline.main: Budget Deal Heads for Senate Approval as More Republicans Give Support
headline.print_headline: Budget Deal Heads for Senate Approval as More Republicans Give Support
